name: Bilyara House - in the heart of Tanunda
description:
SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF TANUNDA

Bilyara House offers a perfectly central location to explore the region, located adjacent to Tanunda Main Street.

Our décor is modern and comfortable with tasteful reflections of the house’s 1940s' and 50’s romance and Art Deco Style. It has an Open Wood Fireplace.

The space
It is designed to accommodate up to 8 guests comfortably with 3 bedrooms and 2 Bathrooms. Breakfast provisions can be supplied for cooked breakfast made up of the best local produce on first night.

The Butcher, Baker & Supermarket are also within short walking distance, allowing you to make your own home cooked fine dining experience as our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 8 people.

HISTORY

Built in 1947, Bilyara House was the home of one of the Wallent Sons. The Wallents were well kn
neighborhood_overview:
Bilyara House offers you a perfect location in the centre of the Tanunda Township to begin you exploration of the Barossa Valley, it wineries, restaurants and fine food experiences.

You will be able to walk to the local supermarket, butcher and baker if you want to self cater. All of these stock the fine local provisions the region is known for.

Alternatively you may like to visit the local Barossa Farmers Markets located within 10 mins drive on Saturday Morning. Here the local store holders provide everything from fresh fruit and seasonal veg, baked goods, condiments, curries, ice creams and the list goes on.

But there is no need to cook! Bilyara house is located across the road from 2 of the Barossa’s fine dining experiences – Ferment Asian and 1918.

description:
The Art Box is a unique home and gallery. It is close to the town centre, including wine & cheese tasting, restaurants, supermarket and parks.. You’ll love it here because of the fabulous views, your private spaces, walking distance to services and a gallery of my eclectic range of art .. The Art Box is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. Check Airbnb experiences to see what creatives I might have available.

The space
The Art box offers you a private bedroom, private lounge, own bathroom and toilet, outdoor area and private access. Our house is open plan and has levels. Your space is on the higher level and each room has a door. Robes are provided for you as you move from your living space to your bathroom. The only steps (5) on this level are to your bathroom.
There is ducted air conditioning for the warmer months , the house is fueled by a wood fire which is in our living area but can warm your quarters also. Additional hea
neighborhood_overview: We are situated in a residential area where hills and trees are the backdrop. a beautiful spot. As we are situated toward the rear of the block it is very quiet and private.
host_about:
I am a contemporary artist and my home is my studio and gallery. I share the space with Stefan and our fur kids; Merri, Cub, Merlin and Phineas.
The environment is my inspiration and gives me peace and joy.
If you choose to stay with us you will gain access to my gallery and perhaps a sneaky art class.

name: Barossa Family Holiday Home BONUS wine & Breakfast
description:
Our relaxing family home is spacious & beautiful. There is plenty to do here, or the perfect place to relax after enjoying all the Barossa has to offer. Perfect for a large family or friendly couples to enjoy. TVs in most room. We have a mini gym, table tennis, Foxtel, outdoor entertaining and plenty of activities to keep kids/families entertained. Fresh comfy linen supplied.Pets negotiable.

The space
Our space is unique as it has the luxury of most other accommodations however it is also family friendly. It will be just as great for 3-4 couples to stay (please request extra double beds if this is the case) as it would be for a large family or even 2 family's to enjoy. With this in mind sharing the cost makes or beautiful home great value. Baby needs are also accommodated with a high chair and portacot supplied. Guests would be able to stay home for a rest day and still have as much to do, as if they had gone out! Us having 4 kids makes our home great for people
neighborhood_overview:
Lyndoch is a beautiful base for exploring the Barossa. In Lyndoch we have online grocery shopping and pizza delivery available yet we also have amazing local dining in this quiet aesthetic town. From fine dining at the lord Lyndoch to the best cafe meal around at Kies winery Monkey nut cafe (lunch only) Lyndoch is surrounded by the beautiful Barossa ranges (of which you can see from our kitchen) and vineyards on every edge of town. The local people are friendly and always happy to help, and if you want to venture further into the Barossa we are a short 10minute drive to Tanunda!
If you are looking for accommodation for an event such as "day on the green" or a wedding, we are happy to provide transport to and from the event for a small fee so you won't even have to wait for a taxi (and much cheaper to)
host_about: I'm a registered nurse turned b&b owner. I have four beautiful children, a wonderful husband and the best dad & sister a girl could ask for. Plus an amazing Mother in law who enjoys this b&b experience with me. We are Loving the Barossa life :)

name: Go Go's, Eden Valley the Garden of Grapes and Gums
description:
Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.
With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases.

The space
In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas.
“Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley.
The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley
neighborhood_overview:
The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their wines. Many people visit the region for the quality and varietals of wine they have to offer to suit every pallet. The cooler climate of the Eden Valley creates zesty Rieslings, the Barossa Valley offers bold Shiraz, and the Adelaide Hill's crisp clean whites are only a short drive away too.
Local wineries include Henschke and Yalumba, plus numerous boutique cellar doors such as Fernfield Wines just 3km away and Edenmae 10km away in Springton.
South Australia and the Barossa Region are proud of more than just their quality grapes, but other gourmet foods galore. There are lots of opportunities to "Eat Local" in the main towns, or purchase delicious produce from the Mount Pleasant or Angaston Farmers Markets if visiting on a Saturday morning, which you can relax and enjoy at home in the comfort of Go Go's. Alternatively wander 100m down the street to the friendly Eden Valley Hotel where they can provide a quality value f

description:
BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895
Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity it has to offer.

Buckbury End Farm is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and is minutes to some fabulous wineries. It is a perfect base for your wine adventure.

The North Para river meanders it's way through and creates a spectacular backdrop continually changing with each season.

Other local attractions include the Whispering Wall, Lavender Farm &Jacobs Creek.

The space
Perfect for a staycation or as a work-from-home alternative.

We are taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations.

FARM COTTAGE - Private, freshly renovated stone cottage set on a 100 acre farm.

The farm cottage consists of stone walls, freshly renovated inside with a nice touch of modern yet trying to retain the old country feel.

Enjoy the peace

name: Mount Pleasant - Namgarina Vineyard
description:
Our property is 12 Ha with a 2 Ha vineyard comprising Shiraz & Riesling. It is approximately 1.25 hours from Adelaide airport and within 45mins to 2 hrs from 6 of the major wine areas of South Australia, & many popular tourist destinations. Mount Pleasant (4.5Km) has 2 hotels, 2 bakeries, chemist, medical centre, hospital, butcher, fuel, convenience store, golf course & bowling club.

The space
We provide a comfortable, clean and bright double room and are happy to share the kitchen, living and outdoor spaces. If needed we have a cot for a small child and, could squeeze in an extra young child or two on spare mattresses if requested and organised ahead of time.
We provide complimentary, tea and coffee, and a continental breakfast. Guests are welcome to some space in the fridge and we also have room in the freezer if needed. Guests are also welcome to use the barbeque.
All bed linen and towels are provided.
We would like people to feel comfortable
neighborhood_overview:
Mount Pleasant is at the top of the River Torrens catchment. It is known as 'big tree" country and many of the trees in the are are hundreds of years old, including some on our property. We are situated between the Adelaide Hills and Barossa wine regions and right next door to Eden Valley. Mount Pleasant has a very active community and some of the community inspired projects include the local produce market(Sat am), a "Recreate Program" (recycling, upcycling and re-purposing) with shop front outlet, an active Men's shed and a number of sporting venues(golf, tennis, bowling).
There are cellar doors as near as Springton, Mount Torrens, and Gumeracha.
At Gumeracha you sill find the "Big Rocking Horse"which sells specialty wooden toys and is attached to a small wildlife park where you can see kangaroos.
Mount Pleasant is only 30 minutes from Mannum on the River Murray which has a variety of dining venues and opportunities for hiring canoes or houseboats.
host_about:
My family has lived in the Southern  Barossa area of the Adelaide Hills in South Australia for fifteen years. We have have a small working vineyard on a picturesque property.
My husband and I have travelled to other countries where we valued personal contact and hospitality. We enjoy hosting visitors, especially from other countries and we would like to share this idyllic environment with others.

name: The Old Manse Shed, Barossa Valley
description: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
host_about: I am an English girl living the dream here in the stunning Barossa Valley.  I am married with two children, two soppy Labradors and a cat. I am crazy about baking, cooking, wine, family and friends. We live in what is the former Rectory / Manse in this tiny Hamlet of Light Pass, just a few minutes drive from all the gems of the Barossa, namely Angaston, Tanunda and Nuriootpa.  We look forward to welcoming you into our much loved home and hearing your stories.  I am fortunate to work in Australia's oldest family owned winery and so meeting people is literally part of my job and just love it.

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Cottage. Luxury & Privacy.
description:
Set amongst vineyards and tranquil gardens, exclusive luxury for one couple and perfect for unwinding or celebrating any special occasion.
Luxury facilities & amenities, peace, quiet, fresh country air and privacy - relax and indulge!
Great location, close to Hentley Farm, Fino, Seppeltsfield, Appellation, Barossa Valley Estate and Izway Wines...so much to see and do. We are great at sharing our local knowledge and helping with touring recommendations during your stay!

The space
Perfect for celebrating any special occasion or just for a holiday, the cottage is a wonderful place to relax as well as the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Many international guests comment it is a welcome "home away from home" if they are travelling for an extended period.

The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of estate wine, gourmet platter produce, free WiFi and complimentary restau
neighborhood_overview:
We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You can even book to make your own knife (but plan and book well ahead!) You will also find Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske, Whistler, Tscharke, Seiber and Torbreck, to name just a few!
Seppeltsfield is the perfect place for walk
host_about:
Meeting people and introducing them to all the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what I love to do.  Having been in luxury accommodation previously in a boutique Barossa hotel I am now enjoying the more personal and intimate side of running this beautiful BnB.  I love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowlege and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region. This keeps life interesting and fulfilling!

With an interest in photography and home styling I get to indulge in this passion with styling the cottage and Retreat and taking photos for our website, social media and other projects.

Peter and Sharyn (original owners) spent two years back in 2001 restoring the 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and creating the beautiful vineyard and gardens you see today. They are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. I love to share their story and the history of the cottage with our guests.

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations! 

My philosophy of "it's the little things that count" will be evident when you stay with us.

name: Indulge and Relax Tanunda
description:
Comfortable, modern cottage within 5-10 minute walk of the centre of Tanunda. Perfect base for touring wineries, easy walk from FermentAsian Restaurant, 1918 bistro, as well as cafes, bakeries and supermarket of central Tanunda.

Full modern kitchen and bathroom, peaceful garden with several relaxing areas to sip a glass of wine, chat or read.

The space
Suitable for one or two couples or small family. Grassed areas (great for bocce and cartwheels!), bunk beds (cot and highchair available), pool table, dart board and two mountain bikes for guest use (please email us your heights to check with available sizes).

Washing machine and dryer, high speed NBN WiFi equipped office area and Netflix access through Apple TV included.

Gas BBQ and heated patio area for outdoor dining year round.

Guest access
Quality Riedel Glassware.

Coffee pod machine and coffee plunger both available in full kitchen includ
neighborhood_overview:
Most cellar doors in the Barossa Valley are open 7 days for free wine tastings, mostly 10am or 11am until 4pm or 5pm (no booking required).

Eating at local restaurants, especially FermentAsian and 1918 (both walking distance from the house) may require a booking in advance and are thoroughly recommended

Tanunda Foodland Supermarket 5-10 minute walk or easy drive away.

name: Somerton House
description:
Somerton House is the perfect place for 1 or 2 couples to relax and enjoy the beautiful Barossa Valley after a hard day wine tasting and sampling regional produce. The outside entertaining area is equipped with a dining table and full size sofa, perfectly positioned in front of the outside television. Or relax in our solar heated pool if the weather is fine. Guests must be over 18 as the house is not suited to children or infants.

The space
Somerton House was built in 1925 but has had some more recent modern additions. It is a wonderful mix of charm with all of the modern comforts. The house has ducted evaporative cooling for the summer months and has central heating to keep you cosy in the winter.

Guest access
Cars are parked securely behind a electronic panel lift door and from there you are able to access the entire home.

Other things to note
Over 18’s only

This property has only 1 Toilet
neighborhood_overview: Friendly quiet neighbourhood. Please be considerate to our neighbours as it is a quiet residential street.

name: The Stables at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
description:
This old stone building has been in use since the 1860s, including as crop storage, machinery shed and stables.
Now it’s been reimagined into a secluded hideaway for two with the perfect ingredients for pure luxury. There’s more of everything in The Stables – set on its own 500m2 block away from the other cottages, it includes a large living space, a spacious entertaining deck, private garden, high ceilings, cathedral skylights, extra large spa bath and log fire to cuddle up next to.

The space
Recharge your senses and enjoy a restful escape in the heart of boutique wine country at 1860 Wine Country Cottages, only an hour’s drive from Adelaide.
Here you’ll find all the ingredients for a relaxing break away from the everyday:
•Explore new tastes. Work your way through our three unique Boutique Wine and Food Trails, designed to give you a taste of the very best Eden Valley and the Adelaide Hills has to offer.
•Take a stroll on the wild side.

name: "LiebenGott" - Luxury 4 bedroom, central location
description:
Luxury 2 storey home in the heart of the Barossa Valley with pool table and antique baby grand piano.

3 bedrooms have queen beds and the 4th with a double with bunk and an extra bed, suitable for a fourth couple or children.

A small park borders the home on 2 sides with room to play cricket, football or soccer!

Prepare your own meals in the fully equipped kitchen or take short stroll to the Weintal for breakfast, lunch or dinner, or dine out at anyone of the famous Barossa restaurants.

The space
Guests have use of the whole home regardless of whether it is 1, @ or 10 guests in your party.

Guest access
Access to garage is available on request
host_about:
Married with three children
Attend C3 Christian Church in Hahndorf, Adelaide Hills
Interests: Motoring enthusiast, water sports, gardening
State Director NSW & SA for Cement Concrete Aggregates Australia

name: The Writer's Studio, Barossa
description:
Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained.
It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.
Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard.
This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary. Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder.

The space
The Writer's Studio is great for singles or couples.
I originally called it, The Shed, as it was once a hay shed with three walls and a grass floor. It morphed into The Writer's Studio after various friends asked to use it as their retreat to spend time quietly catching up on writing projects.
Wineries abound, as do eating opportunities, ranging from the award winning Appellation at The Louise and fermentAsian (consistently names in t
neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly opposite the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work for not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. Thanks to (Hidden by Airbnb) I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Martinsell Cottage
description:
A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables.
(Please note all extra guests,including toddlers ,are charged $45)
The cottage is set on the estate 500m from one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in 1901.
This is also available for accomodation of up to four guests please log in to Martinsell Manor for further details.https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387

The space
There is a lovely large lounge with cosy wood heater and split system reverse cycle air conditioner and a fully equipped kitchen. The cottage is in a very peaceful country location with the closest neighbour being a kilometre away. Shower or bath in our soft rainwater provided to the cottage, whilst the outside taps are supplied with spring water.
No wi fi available

Horses are welcome with secure yards and plenty of parking for horse floats. Daily permits
neighborhood_overview:
The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods.

The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, fishing, kayaking, wine tasting and more.

Closest large stores:
Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including;
•Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat
•24 hr petrol station

The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store with limited supplies and a bottle shop.

We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia, through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges.

A Barossa Valley in
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.
neighbourhood: Pewsey Vale, Barrossa Valley , South Australia, Australia

name: Historic home on 65 acres in top Barossa location
description:
Premium self-contained accommodation in a fantastic central location. Hanisch Haus is a recently renovated home built in 1907. Guests have full access to the entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.
An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility of the property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. Full breakfast provisions are included with a bottle of Rolf Binder wine.

The space
What's special about our place?
1. The Location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping.
2. Space - A lovely spacious home ideal for longer stays and especially those who like to cook and feel 'at home' when travelling.
3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife / bir
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

Hill House offers unique accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston.

name: MAGNIFICENT COUNTRY VILLA - SPACIOUS & UNIQUE.
description:
Looking for the perfect place to stay in the Barossa Valley with your friends and family? The "Coffee Palace" is an historic property with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and all the amenities to be self-contained. Your elegant and spacious home in the Barossa to relax in, enjoy and share. Conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Lyndoch village, walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries.

The space
The Coffee Palace provides 7 bedrooms in total, over 3 floors.
Bedroom 1 – A beautiful and spacious bedroom on the ground floor, with elegant ensuite, claw foot bathtub and dressing room. The bed can be configured as a king or twin room.
Bedroom 2 – The bed in this room can be configured as a king or twin beds. Bathrooms for this room are on the landing, so up a few stairs and there is also a separate toilet just out on the back veranda for convenience during outdoor activities.
Bedroom 3 – Another very spacious bedroom, lo
neighborhood_overview: The Coffee Palace is located in the quiet town of Lyndoch which has all the necessary facilities including a general store, fine dining restaurant, hotel with dining room, cafe, bakery, butcher, hair dresser, cellar door, post office and library.  We are a very short stroll to the main street.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cats, including Leonard, Polly and Blackie (the waif who comes for breakfast). We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

description:
Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close by, walking distance to chemist, local pubs, bakeries, butchers and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events.

Our place is quiet and has a beautiful outlook onto the property.

Guest access

If you wish to use the fire pit or the wood fire pizza oven, wood will be available at an extra cost, you can certainly
neighborhood_overview: Mount pleasant is a quiet little town with about 950 people, about an hour from Adelaide, 40mins to The quaint little german township called Hahndorf, 30mins to the historic river town of Mannum, home of the first paddle steamers, we have lots of wineries within a 45min radius of us and a lovely Farmers market every Saturday Morning where you can get the best cooked breakfast.
host_about: Hello I'm Maureen, my husband and I love to travel, we are also Airbnb hosts and love it. We adore our 4 girls and 7 grandchildren, I  like to cook for the family, and make special memories with them and our friends.  We also like to garden and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent - privacy, luxury, nature
description:
Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment. Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.

The space
The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.
A large queen size bed, kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities, and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.
The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided.
Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.

Gu
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries and farms.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

This lovely 1920's cottage is located in a quiet tree lined street in the heart of Tanunda.
Miriam's is a 5 minute walk to shops and restaurants such as Ferment Asian, 1918, Musque and cafe's. Also walking distance to Langmeil winery, Peter Lehmann, Z Wines etc

Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms, accommodating up to 11.

Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi

The villa is alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea supplied and beautiful vineyard views

host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

name: Barossa Dreams and Apartments perfect for groups
description:
Best of both worlds in Tanunda, Barossa Valley Apartments modern 2 x 4 apts and Barossa Dreams 1890's federation home offers 6 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms on one property. Complimentary Wi-Fi and a swimming pool exclusive to guests hiring whole property & lovely garden to relax & unwind. Combining both properties can accommodate up to 33 people. Enhance your stay with a wine tour, airport/restaurant transfer. We can organise your ultimate getaway.
2 night min. majority of weekends.

The space
also ideal for corporate groups and can arrange extra experiences to enjoy during your stay. Two apartments in Barossa Valley Apartments are on upper level so there is stairs. Great location all in Tanunda walking distance to restaurant, a couple of wineries and cafes.

Guest access
Complimentary Wi-Fi and access to swimming pool, walk to shops, cafes and wineries and brewery, also access to our facilities of arranging our award winning tours to complete
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a wonderful community and do respect the privacy and noise for our neighbours. So no parties or access to the swimming pool after dark.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
description:
The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.
There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.
The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer

The space
If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through th
neighborhood_overview:
Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.

We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tour
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.

name: Pinecone Ridge, Barossa - your own 16 acres
description:
Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pine Cone Ridge is for you.

The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards, and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside.

The space
The 16 acre property provides a natural habitat for kangaroos and native birds and early risers can enjoy watching hot air balloons drift across the valley. Fiery summer sunsets & sunrises; autumnal colours; misty winter mornings crisp with frost; and the blossom of spring - the outlook is constantly changing.

The house is self contained with a fully functional kitchen, big comfy couches and a wide selection of games, books, jigsaws & DVDs for your entertainment. Netflix & free WiFi are also available.

Curl up by the wood fire with your favourite port in
neighborhood_overview:
Pine Cone Ridge is 2km from the main street of Angaston.

Angaston is arguably the prettiest of the towns in the Barossa. Set amongst rolling hills it offers a well-preserved heritage streetscape lined by large leafy trees. It also sits on the border of the Barossa & Eden Valleys making a perfect base from which to explore both wine regions. It is home to the Barossa Cheese Company, Yalumba, Vitners restaurant, Taste Eden Valley, and the not-to-be-missed Barossa Farmers Market amongst many other attractions.
host_about:
Hi! 

Pinecone Ridge is really a family project - we are all involved: Anne, Josh, Jeb, April & Isla.

We purchased the property in Nov 2017 as a family escape & renovation project. The property had previously been owned by a 92 year old gentleman with poor eyesight & needed lots of attention but we could see the potential & loved the views & location.

Running Pinecone Ridge is a family affair. April creates the welcome signs. Isla collects the pinecones. Jeb is Josh’s right hand man when it comes to maintenance. I get the privilege of escaping to the Barossa every week to clean & prep & often Josh is able to join me. In school holidays the kids help too. And we have all contributed to the eclectic styling of the home!

We have created Pinecone Ridge to be our family getaway - cosy, comfortable, fun, creative, peaceful, surrounded by nature - a place in which to clear the head & relax into a slower pace of life, yet also close to the action & deliciousness of the Barossa. We love sharing it with you and reading your reviews together. May you have a wonderful stay!

Anne

name: Pembury Cottage ~ Angaston,  Barossa, Pet freindly
description:
PEMBURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON

Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region.

Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1800s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.

The space
Pembury is a luxury self-contained property, beautifully renovated, classic late 1800s cottage, with a modern and comfortable décor and secure backyard suitable for pets. Located in historic Angaston Pembury Cottage comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests with 3 king sized bedrooms and a spacious shower/wet room and 2 toilets. House trained pets are welcome.
Secure back yard, we do request you do not leave your dogs unattended as we have had issues with dogs barking all day while guests are out.
Provisions are supplied for a continental breakfa
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley.

Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region.
Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
host_about:
Hi
We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.
Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa taste sensations and Kate is a Physiotherapist.
we enjoy introducing our guests to the area and have a wealth of knowledge at our finger tips to help you have a fantastic stay

name: Sanctuary in the Valley 3 bedrooms 2 bathrooms
description:
This lovely modern home ideally located in the Barossa Valley. Offers 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, relax and enjoy the beautiful garden and outdoor area. Fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities available too. Free WIFI and undercover parking for 2, and 2 in driveway.
We do have minimum stays over long weekends, school holidays and Christmas time, generally a 3 night min. We also would love to offer our services for our wine touring business Getaways SA to showcase our backyard.

The space
fully equipped kitchen, open plan kitchen, dine and lounge area overlooking the garden.
neighborhood_overview: We ask that you please respect our neighbourhood in regards to excessive noise. We live in a lovely quiet community, so please no parties or loud noise.

name: Beauchamp House B&B
description:
Beauchamp House is set on a 168 Acre farm with Splendid gardens and views of the hills around you. We welcome you to stay and enjoy the quite and peaceful nature of Beauchamp House and discover all the Barossa Valley has to offer. Our 1870 built home is open for you to use and we dont book seperate people in that you dont know so if it's just the 2 people or a group of 6 the place is entirely yours. Sit back and relax or go for a walk and check out the animlas we have around the farm.

The space
Beauchamp has 3 Bedrooms 2 with queens and one with a king bed and 2 rooms come with Ensuite and the other has a bathroom not far from it. Beauchamp house is a little luxuary with the old charms of a hills home. Guests on arrival will receive a bottle of wine and a cheese platter and all breakfast provisions while staying with us. Coffee machine and easy to you wood fired pizza oven add to the many amazing things that come with Beachamp house.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: Rolling Hills, beautiful paddocks with cows and horses fill your views. Mount Pleasant is only a short 5min drive away and there is wineries every direction you can go. Saturday morning farmers markets are on in Mount Pleasant or an evening meal at one of the hotels.

name: Luxury In Langmeil Estate
description:
Based in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 'Luxury in Langmeil Estate' is the ultimate place to stay to give the best Barossa experience, iconic Barossa wineries such as Peter Lehmann and Langmeil are only a very short stroll away

The house includes 2 bathrooms (1 with spa), 3 bedrooms (1 Kingsize, 1 Queen , 1 Double ). full kitchen facilities and laundry facilities as well as relaxing outdoor area.

Just a short 15 minute walk to the heart of Tanunda a perfect spot for shopping or dining

name: Goat Square Cottages - Flaxman Cottage
description:
Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa.
Your cottage has two bedrooms - a King and a Queen. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine.
Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download
Escape to Goat Square

The space
Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.
Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities.
Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate.
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Hutton Vale Farm - Hutch Hilton
description:
Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa.

The space
Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating.
An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed) lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip.

Guest access
Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in)
Also a great experience is to visit t
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike track, parks and 2 golf courses.
host_about: I am part of a mixed family farm in the Barossa, with a strong interest in food and wine.

name: Discovery Holiday Parks
description:
Luxury Executive accommodation nestled in the heart of the Barossa Valley. These ultra modern three bedroom villas have all the comforts of home plus more. Ideal for couples or families sleeping up to 6 guests.

The space
There are very few wine lovers who have not sampled a drop from the Barossa Valley. Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination is also the home of Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley. Our caravan park is just a few minutes from the centre of Tanunda, a great place to begin your tour.

Explore the vine-covered plains and hills that surround charming townships and Lutheran churches, with their distinctive square spires dotting the rural landscape. Or, enjoy our new splashtacular waterpark! 3 slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count = fun for the whole family. With so many wineries, historic buildings, museums, scenic tours, bush walks, art galleries, amazing dining

It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.

name: Fernweh Guesthouse Bethany Room w/buffet breakfast
description:
An amazing location right in Tanunda. Walk to FermentAsian and 1918 restaurants (300m). A hosted guesthouse with exceptional full breakfast. A solid brass queen sized bed and an ensuite with underfloor heating, air-conditioner and table and chairs. Shared Formal Lounge and Dining Rooms with a wood fire heater, mahogany furniture, television and free wifi and parking. Electric bikes and our day tour available. Nibbles provided on arrival. A professionally operated Guesthouse.




 

The space
Breakfast is included which comprises an outstanding cooked breakfast from our menu, self serve cereals, fruits, bakery and dairy options and a great range of prepared tea and coffee.
Enjoy the convenience of the shared kitchenette,which includes a fridge, microwave, washing machine, iron and ironing board. The formal garden and BBQ facitilities are available.
We also have two other rooms available for guests - Langmeil Room (amazing king
neighborhood_overview: Three hundred meters from the centre of Tanunda and the Information Centre. Walk to great restaurants (including FermentAsian 300m), ten cafes, great bakery and wineries within walking distance. We live in an extremely quiet location in the centre of town, 300 meters of the main street. There is no traffic noise at night.
host_about: Christine and I have a love of travel. Fernweh (pronounced fern-way means a love of travel to far away places). Our travels have taken us throughout Europe and Asia. We are committed to providing an outstanding experience for guests who stay with us. We can assure you of a friendly welcome. Our registered private day tours and electric bike hire allows guests to have some excellent experiences with us.

name: Jesmond Dene - Barossa
description:
Jesmond Dene is a four to five minute stroll from award winning restaurants, delicious coffee and regional gourmet stores showcasing Barossa specialty food on the main street in Angaston.

A 1921 Australian bungalow the house features timber floors, three double bedrooms, two bathrooms, lounge, fully appointed kitchen, separate dining room and is yours exclusively during your stay.

The space
Enjoy short stays away with friends or family to experience all the Barossa Valley has to offer.

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery House..Get it all!
description:
Located in the historic section of Lyndoch township, the gateway to the Barossa Valley (1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD). Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable accommodation with an entire end of this unique 1850’s colonial building constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed until 1912. Price is for 2 guests. Additional guests are $20/person/night. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.

The space
5 minute walk to town centre with shops, restaurants, hotel, supermarket etc. The B&B is an entire 2 bedroom house (including free wifi), with lounge, kitchen, dining, laundry, bathroom and private rear patio/pergola/garden. There is a sofa-bed in the lounge room which can possibly be used by negotiation.

If you have a big group, the other larger side (totally separate with 3 bedrooms [main with king sized 4 poster], family room, meals area, lounge [o
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the ‘Gateway’ to the Barossa Valley. The residence gives you local ambience and history, whilst providing you the opportunity to explore this vibrant tourist wine & food region. Tanunda, Nuriootpa, Angaston and other Barossa Valley towns are all an easy drive way. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the B&B.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

There is an air conditioner and wood fire. Breakfast is included which comprises an outstanding cooked breakfast from our menu, self serve cereals, fruits and dairy options and a great range of prepared teas and coffees. Enjoy!

An ideal location right in the heart of Tanunda. 300 metres from excellent restaurants (including FermentAsian), ten cafes and a stroll to outstanding wineries. An ideal romantic weekend getaway or honeymoon sweet.
We operate Fernweh Guesthouse on a professional basis. You are guaranteed a safe and secure stay in most elegant surroundings.

name: Martinsell Manor  Barossa Valley South Australia
description:
Private accommodation, self-contained in the downstairs section of this grand Manor. The main entrance provides access leading into your spacious lounge and dining area. Martinsell Manor, a historical, stately, stone building is set on 77 acres in beautiful surroundings within the picturesque Barossa region. The impressive guest suites have recently been renovated and include high ceilings, quality Georgian and Chippendale furniture, and Persian carpets on polished floorboards.

The space
A magnificent piece of South Australian history, this turn of the century home has played host to some prominent Australian and international aristocrats, politicians and business people. The grand rooms and opulent architecture give glimpses of a bygone era. Adelaide's Ashburton Design has seamlessly blended the old world charm with his colours and furnishings, to make a beautiful and elegant environment. The private accommodation is rented as a whole area. A getaway for yours
neighborhood_overview: The Manor is 20 minutes from Tanunda
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.

name: Fernweh Guesthouse Tanunda Room w/ buffet b'fast
description:
Fernweh Guesthouse is elegant luxury. The house was built in 1925 and remains one of the iconic buildings of the town. Enjoy your outstanding breakfast buffet, hot serve meal and made to order coffee or tea at one of the most romantic accommodation places in the Barossa Valley. We have electric bikes for hire and day tours for our guests. Enjoy a bottle of wine and snacks on arrival. The outstanding location allows our guests to walk 300m to FermentAsian and 1918 restaurants.

The space
Fernweh Guesthouse is a hosted bed and breakfast and is located right in the heart of Tanunda, with excellent restaurants and cafes 300 metres ways. Located in a very quiet area of town off the main street, you are assured of total peace and quiet. Outstanding wineries (including Langmeil and Peter Lehmann) are 15 minutes walk from our accommodation.
It is possible to book all three Fernweh Guesthouse rooms. Contact us for discounted rates.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: Our Guesthouse is located three hundred metres off the main street in Tanunda in an exceptionally quiet location. With parkland across the road and located amongst magnificent old properties, your privacy and peace and quiet is guaranteed to ensure a most pleasant stay.
host_about: Christine and I have a love of travel. Fernweh (pronounced fern-way means a love of travel to far away places). Our travels have taken us throughout Europe and Asia. We are committed to providing an outstanding experience for guests who stay with us. We can assure you of a friendly welcome. Our registered private day tours and electric bike hire allows guests to have some excellent experiences with us.

name: Linfield Cottage
description:
Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines.

Guest access
You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door.

Other things to note
The cottage is situated next to our Cellar Door, which is open Thursday - Sunday. With a separate entrance and plenty of seclusion, you are sure to have a private getaway.
The property is a working vineyard, not fenced and with several dams and waterways.
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything.
host_about:
We live and work on our beautiful vineyard property. We love cooking and enjoying a bottle of our wine overlooking the property. 
Travelling is always on the list of things to do when we have downtime. 
Reading is a great passion in our family and our choices wide and varied.

name: WHISTLER VINEYARD RETREAT
description:
Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock.

The space
Our home was designed by us and built in 2002 on a hill overlooking our vineyards. A purpose-built, private two bedroom guest wing with separate entrance, offers fully self-contained accommodation for up to 4 guests. The second bedroom can be configured as a king bed or two singles. Features include a full kitchen with bar fridge and a large open space living area with floor to ceiling windows to capture the views. The living area and both bedrooms have large windows an
neighborhood_overview: Our Retreat is on the most scenic road in the Barossa with 15 wineries to discover, including the historic Seppeltsfield Winery. An exciting new addition, within walking distance, is the new Seppeltsfield Road Distillers where you can enjoy handcrafted gin on their stunning deck. We have world-class restaurants within a 5 minute drive - Appellation, Fino and Hentley Farm. Our neighbours are the famous Maggie Beer Farmshop and Eatery. The work of top SA artists can be seen at the JamFactory gallery and artisan workshops. Other coffee shops, galleries and excellent shopping can be found at the 3 main towns, all within 5km from our home. The first stage of the new Seppeltsfield Road  shared path trail runs through our property. The Barossa also has other bike trails.
host_about: I'm a born and bred, proud Barossan. Married to Martin for 44 years we have 3 adult children and 6 grandchildren. 30 years of teaching has kept me young at heart. I love meeting people through our family winery and I'm very involved in the local community. I'm known as 'the Green Queen', somewhat obsessed with  recycling and caring for the environment. I'm an animal and nature-lover, loving life on our beautiful property and happy to share it with others.

description:
At Queen’s Cottage we want you to have the best accommodation experience when staying in the Barossa Valley. Queen's Cottage is officially Star Rated at 4.5 Stars and we are in a great location with wineries, vineyards, cafes, pubs and attractions on the doorstep. If you are looking for ‘exclusive use’ Couple or Small Group (6) BnB Accommodation in the Barossa or Self-contained Accommodation in the Barossa, then you’re looking for Queen’s Cottage.

The space
1 King bedroom and 2 Queen bedrooms.
Breakfast Provisions.
Local bottle of wine and cheese platter.
Afternoon tea and other treats.

Log Fire.

You have the whole self-contained cottage to yourselves.

name: Archery Road Estate - surrounded by vineyards
description:
Tucked away in a vineyard setting with amazing views of the Barossa Ranges, your wine estate is in a perfect setting. With four bedrooms and two lounge areas plus two bathrooms and a well equipped kitchen you have it all. The spacious decking overlooks expansive gardens - this is great wine country lodging.
Wander the trails to the River. There's even a Tennis Court so bring your racquets!
Depending on the season, you may find Matt working in the vineyards or paddocks adjoining the house.

Guest access
Archery Road Estate is a working vineyard farm. There are sheds - please don't go into them. There are vineyards - again please stay out of them.
Matt may be using farm equipment - stay well clear

Other things to note
Archery Road Estate is part of the Cottages4u group.
Cottages4u is a group of long standing BnB cottage operators who have a proven track record in the local industry.
Established in 1997, the group und
neighborhood_overview: You are in one of the most picturesque spots in the Barossa. Make the most of the walking trails down to the North Para River
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

keep warm in front of the fire place during the winter mths.

description:
Barossa Valley wine region

Take a step back in time and stay in a piece of Australian history, this historic home is located in the heart of the Barossa Valley.

Antique and country style decor in a genuine 1860's Cottage - a beautiful piece of Barossa history with many treasures to view inside. Ideal getaway for romantic weekends by the fire, with convenient location close to many Barossa attractions, wineries, gourmet dining.

Your cottage is a historic treasure; a truly relaxing hideaway.

The space
You’ll have the full cottage to yourself, to enjoy at your leisure.

Guest access
Guests have full access to all of this gorgeous historic cottage.

Other things to note

Antique and country style decor in a genuine 1860's Cottage restored to modern convenient living. Ideal getaway for family holidays, romantic weekends with convenient location close to many Barossa attractions, wineries, gourmet dining etc. Log wood fire with generous wood supply provided in cosy lounge. TV, DVD and music for entertainment. Sleeps up to 6 guests - 3 bedrooms - two with queen beds and one with 2 single beds. Continental breakfast included in tariff with coffee and tea provisions. Complimentary bottle of Barossa wine and gourmet snacks, chocolates and port provided with stays of two nights or longer. Modern equipped kitchen, separate indoor dining room seating 6. Laundry facilities, modern bathroom with luxurious spa, large shower, toilet and separate second toilet for guest convenience. name: The Barn - a little bit rustic, a little bit luxe
description:
Nestled on 5 acres in the Barossa Valley, Pondicherri Village and The Barn is a private property and hosts accommodation in a village atmosphere in the separate outbuildings. The extensive rural views and privacy are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger working farms. Combined with rural amenity, Pondicherri Village has several historical buildings and creates a rustic oasis, yet is close to all that the beautiful Barossa Valley offers. The Barn is one of those buildings.

The space
The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams. The building is aged well over 100 years. We are not sure of its original use. Today, the Barn is furnished with a very comfortable super-sized king bed complete with crisp white sheets and natural fibre quality bed linens. In winter, you will keep very toasty with the individual dual zoned electric blankets. The bed is so spacious, it is also perfect for travell
neighborhood_overview:
We are only 5 minutes drive to the historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes, numerous restaurants ranging from great takeaways/dine in options to fine dining, 2 pubs, a florist, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, speciality Barossa food businesses and some retail therapy.

We are 5 minutes drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning. Closer if you drive via the back way along the dirt road - Saleyards Road left on the bend at Penrice Road. Take care as mobs of kangaroos frequent the area especially early morning and dusk.

There are many high-quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments, and historic buildings to explore across the region. If food and wine are not your things, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park. Or you could go ballooning or
host_about: I do love to travel and for now, South Australia is a bountiful wonderful gift.   I do love to cook and share my table with family and friends.  I love the smell of a newly picked lemon and fresh bunches of garden herbs.  I love my little gentle animals and the flocks of different birds that play and swoon here.  I’m social and then sometimes,  I’m a bit reclusive.   I love the stillness and promise of a dawning sunrise more than the peace and surrender of a sunset, but both are spectacular,  and I’m blessed to experience and appreciate it often.   I’m grateful for living in a place that affords space and privacy.   And I enjoy meeting people!  Welcome to Pondicherri Village - a little bit of rustic, a little bit of luxe, and a whole lot of soul comfort in the Barossa Valley.

name: Goat Square Cottages - historic Menge Cottage
description:
Goat Square Cottages comprises 3 adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Your 1850's cottage is Menge Cottage. It has one bedroom with a King bed & a separate lounge room. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts & a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing & email download Escape to Goat Square

The space
Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.
Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities.
Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will

Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Goat Square Cottages - Kavel Cottage - King Bed
description:
Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa.
Your cottage is called Menge Cottage. It has one bedroom with a King bed. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine.
Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download
Escape to Goat Square soon!

The space
Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.
Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities.
Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experienc
neighborhood_overview:
our cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
We have been to Ha Noi in Viet Nam 5 times and love Viet food - some of the best Viet food we have tasted is from fermentAsian - just up the street from Goat Square Cottages!
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Woodland Cottage
description:
Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience.

The space
Kangaroos and a wide variety of native birds (rosellas, cockatoos, wrens, robins, honey eaters etc) surround the cottage and come close to feed.

Guest access
The cottage is independent of the main house and provides a private space in which to relax. Guests are free to use the walking track on the property and can access the extensive Mt Crawford Forest via the Mawson and Heysen Trails. Please note that there is no kitchen in the cottage but
neighborhood_overview: Birdwood houses the National Motor Museum, worth a visit for motoring enthusiasts. As well as wonderful wineries and restaurants throughout the region, there are other hidden gems such as the Applewood gin distillery in nearby Gumeracha and a fabulous local market on Saturdays at Mt Pleasant.
host_about: Love living on our peaceful 20 acres of Australian bushland between the Barossa  and the Adelaide Hills wine regions. Happily married. Love dogs, bushwalks, Australian native orchids, willdlife, good wine. Love travelling, especially to Europe. My wife and I will try our best to give you a tranquil, comfortable Australian country experience.

name: Red Gum Retreat  with wood fire & free wifi
description:
Set in a scenic location, this century year old iron stone cottage provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences.

The home sits on 1 1/4 acres, and you are free to enjoy the space, take in the views, have a bbq on the terrace and enjoy the gardens and local bird life.

Please contact me if you have any particular requirement that you would like to explore

The space
The self contained accommodation has the standard symmetrical cottage layout, with 4 main rooms, two either side of the central hallway.
The bathroom including powder room overlooking the garden are additional spaces.

The king bed can be separated into 2 king singles if required and a trundle bed is also available.

Other things to note
I am available and have my private separate apartment on the property and respect your privacy, I am generally contactable throughout your stay if there is any information you would like ab
neighborhood_overview: This location is perfect for any trips to local wine options, nationals parks and walking trails.
host_about:
I will be pleased to welcome you in my former home which has great character.
As a professional who works in scientific fields who is well traveled around Australia, I have experienced a wide variety of hospitality venues and attitudes from which to draw.

name: The Dairyman Barossa .. The Chaff House
description:
Exclusive self-contained Farm Accommodation set in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges. A fusion of heritage, functional architecture & edgy style, located between Lyndoch & Williamstown in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Take in the stunning views from every direction – vineyards, rolling hills & farm life.

Enjoy an abundance of traditional breakfast provisions straight from the farm.

Google for more information...thedairymanbarossa

The space
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy.

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, o
neighborhood_overview: We are 5-15 minutes from regional towns and many cellar doors close by
host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury Vineyard Cottage. S Australia
description:
Beautiful villa facing vineyard. French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park on our estate. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included.

The space
A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views.

Guest access
Guest are welcome to stroll around the vineyard, visit the William Light monument and read the history of Barossa Valley.

Other things to note
Cofee and tea is provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.
host_about: I am a Montessori teacher and at present working with children diagnosed with ASD. Love meeting people, friendly and easy going.
