name: Central location with country views
description:
Our 1940's self-contained cottage is located just 5 minutes walk to the main street shops, cafes and playground.
Newly listed, this cottage has been freshly painted, includes new linen and bedding with some antique touches.
The backyard has a view of the hills and creek, and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind for a weekend away. The ideal combination of location and country setting.

The space
The Cottage has been newly furnished and includes some touches of antique furniture to compliment the cottage's heritage.

The open-plan living, dining and kitchen is a very spacious area, giving everyone enough room to relax. The kitchen island bench creates a social space and plenty of room for those who like to cook up a storm. The kitchen is fully equipped including a microwave, fridge and dishwasher. There is tea and coffee included with some fresh fruit on arrival, and a few other kitchen staples supplied.

There are three bedrooms in
neighborhood_overview:
There is so much to explore within walking distance; Barossa Valley Cheese company, several cafes and eateries, playgrounds and walking paths.
You will find information on my other Barossa favourites and towns on arrival, including wineries and walking trails.
The local Barossa Farmers Markets are held every Saturday morning, only 2 minutes drive away.
host_about:
I have lived in the Barossa for over 26 years. I love to call the Barossa home and enjoy sharing knowledge of what our beautiful region has to offer. I have worked in hospitality and the wine industry for 19 years, and customer service is a passion.
I love to explore other regions and have enjoyed several overseas holidays in the last 5 years, staying in several airbnb accommodation.

name: Cirillo Guest House
description:
In the heart of the Barossa, Cirillo Guest House is set in a tranquil and secluded location for the perfect getaway. The house has been recently refurbished, decorated in bright, clean furnishings. The house sits surrounded by some of the oldest vineyards in the world, planted in 1848 owned and operated by the Cirillo family.
The winery estate offers beautiful views of neighbouring vineyards and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind.

The space
Exclusively yours to enjoy, the provincial / Hamptons styled house offers three bedrooms along with modern open plan living spaces. The huge kitchen is fully equipped with an oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. There is a large island bench for communal dining.
The clean and bright bathroom has a rain shower with a separate second toilet located adjacent to the laundry. The laundry has a washing machine and clothes dryer.
There is a fireplace, plus panel heaters in each bedroom for the cooler mo
neighborhood_overview: The property backs onto the Barossa Bike Trail. We are a stone’s throw from the Barossa Farmers Market and a short drive from Barossa’s most popular local restaurants and cellar doors.

name: Gateway to the Barossa
description:
Newly refurbished cottage on a private 15 acre farm located at the gateway to the Barossa Valley.

Located a 5-minute drive out of Gawler and only 5 minutes from the closest wineries, you're only a short drive to many of the Barossa favorites including Seppeltsfield, Penfolds, Rockfords, and many, many more!

Our self-contained cottage comes with everything you'll need for a trip out of Adelaide, including a brand new kitchen and bathroom.

The space
The cottage courtyard offers an intimate space to enjoy breakfast under the orange tree or an evening drink after a long day touring the wineries.

The cottage sleeps 2 people in the main bedroom and up to another 2 people on the fold-out couch.

You will be sharing the farm with chickens and a small group of sheep in the back paddock, making this an authentic farm stay.

The owners also come and go from the main house, however, the cottage is privately located for

name: Self Contained Cottage in central Barossa Valley
description:
Located centrally between Nuriootpa and Angaston, Almond Tree Cottage is near local vineyards, the Barossa Bike and Walking track, the renowned Farmers Market and local wineries.
Perfect for a weekend away, the cottage provides comfort at a reasonable rate and features exclusive use for one or two adult guests. One bedroom with Queen size bed with linen supplied. Reverse cycle air conditioning. Kitchen has an electric stove. Generous breakfast provisions included.
No smoking or pets allowed.

The space
Room One: One bedroom with Queen size deluxe bed, quality linen and electric blanket. Smart television, DVD player & 2 chairs. The cottage has reverse cycle air conditioning and an overhead fan.
Room Two: Kitchen with table and chairs for two, bar refrigerator, electric stove, cooking utensils, wine rack, chopping board, microwave oven. Pantry items.
Room Three: Bathroom with heated towel warmer and shower. Towels are supplied.

<
neighborhood_overview: Just a 50 minute drive north east of Adelaide, the Barossa is an internationally-acclaimed wine region encompassing the towns of Tanunda, Angaston and Nuriootpa
host_about:
I am a fifth generation born South Australian from German and English ancestors.
I am now retired, but worked for Tax Agents as a bookkeeper for about 30 years.
My husband and I moved to the Barossa Valley in 2012 and love the peace and quiet of our property, situated on the Barossa floor between Nuriootpa and Angaston.  The small cottage on our property was turned into a Guest house just after we moved in.  We look forward to meeting new people and guests and hope you enjoy your stay in this wonderful area the Barossa Valley with its rich history, wines and dining.

name: 'Mattschoss House c1890' - Barossa comfort & style
description:
'Mattschoss House' offers a unique place in Barossa Valley's history established in '1890'. Refurbished to reflect it's heritage with clean modern furnishings, a comfortable retreat all year round. Set along the Para River with vineyard views, an array of native birds and the infamous Western Ridge sunsets. Centrally located with great access to some of Barossa's iconic wineries and restaurants, with neighboring wineries just a stones throw from your front door.

The space
Whole house to yourself! With modern comfortable furnishings for you to relax and enjoy your time away. Featuring 3 double bedrooms all with luxury Queen beds, reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, fire place in the dining room, large fully equip country style kitchen with modern appliances. The formal lounge room allows you to soak up the warm sunshine, sink into the large sofa or curl up and watch the large screen TV with a glass of wine. The bathroom hosts heated floors, with a half bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the iconic Seppeltsfield Road you are walking distance to neighboring wineries and a short drive to icons like Maggie Beer Farm Shop, Appellation Restaurant, Peter Lehmann Wines, David Franz Wines, and Seppelsfield Winery. The bustling main street of Tanunda is close hosting our Barossa's Tourism hub along with coffee shops, bakeries and retail shops.
On Saturdays you can head to our local Farmer's Market for breakie and meet, taste and explore our finest in produce, baked goods, gin, wine and so much more.
You wont be short of things to do in the Barossa, head to Barossa.com for all the latest. When considering your travel plan at least a few days, there is so much you wont have time to see it all!

name: Budburst House
description:
Budburst is set amongst lush gardens at the end of a quiet street in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Ideal for couples, a group of friends or a family, the house has two living areas, three bedrooms, two bathrooms and a securely fenced backyard and solar heated in-ground pool. Morning sun floods the light-filled open plan living, dining and kitchen area. Centrally located in a tranquil part of town, within walking distance to Tanunda's fabulous restaurants, cafes and shops.

The space
Budburst has been thoughtfully furnished to feel like your home away from home. Inside, at one end of the house an open plan living, dining and kitchen area showcase a modern, light-filled aesthetic. Situated at the other end of the house are three stylish bedrooms which sleep five guests. One bedroom with a luxurious king size bed, another bedroom with a queen bed and the third bedroom with a king single bed. Beautiful views from all three bedrooms of the front garden.
neighborhood_overview: Budburst is situated at the end of  a quiet cul-de-sac, next to a large reserve. It is surrounded by family homes and friendly neighbours. Please respect our neighbours with the noise around the pool area.
host_about: I am a sixth generation Barossan who loves where I live in Tanunda in the beautiful Barossa Valley. Having travelled the world I appreciate quality, stylish accommodation.

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery-Entire Main House!
description:
Located in the historic section of Lyndoch township, the Gateway to the Barossa (1hr from the CBD). Great place to stay fro a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family/group getaway. Extremely comfortable with the entire main house of this unique 1850's colonial building, constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed till 1912, then Lyndoch Bakery. Price is for 2 guests with a nominal price for additonal guests. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.

The space
This is the main house of the Barossa Inn & Bakery BnB facility. A 5 minute walk to the town centre, with shops, restaurant, hotel and supermarket etc.

The BnB is an entire house (including free wifi), with lounge (original 'front bar' of the Inn), kitchen, meals/dining, family, 3 bedrooms, laundry and large backyard.

If you have a big group, the other smaller side (totally separate with 2 bedroom, dining, lounge, kitchen, bathroom, laundry, pat
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the 'Gateway' to the Barossa Valley/ The residence gives you local ambience and history whilst providing a touch of luxury (enjoy the wonderful king-sized four poster-bed!). You have the opportunity to explore this vibrant foor and wine region, with the main Barossa towns - Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston, all an easy drive away. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the BnB. The bicycle track from Angaston to Gawler and beyond, passes nearby. Our BnB is a great starting point for your cycling adventure.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Retreat,  Explore - relax
description:
Set among the vineyards and gardens of our Seize the Day vineyard, our three bedroom house offers relaxed premium self contained accommodation for up to 6 people.
A place to savour and explore the Barossa, to relax, to unwind and to share good company.
A stone’s throw from Seppeltsfield Winery, Hentley Farm and many local boutique cellar doors, restaurants and attractions along our iconic Seppeltsfield Road, the perfect base for you to enjoy your Barossa experience with family or friends.

The space
With plenty of room to move, there are three comfortable bedrooms with crisp fresh beds and linens, a fully equipped kitchen including breakfast supplies, local gourmet produce for a grazing platter and a bottle of local wine. The large dining space has plenty of room to fit everyone for relaxed dining around the large solid oak table, or dine outside overlooking the expansive lawns and garden in one of the outdoor entertaining areas. The sunken lounge room
neighborhood_overview:
Located just off the iconic Seppeltsfield Road.. We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also house the acclaimed FINO restaurant, and the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You will also find Octeine Coffee Cafe, and Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm ( which is right next door to us), Izway Wines, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske, Whistler, Tscharke
host_about:
Meeting people and introducing them to all the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what I love to do.  Having been in luxury accommodation previously in a boutique Barossa hotel I am now enjoying the more personal and intimate side of running this beautiful BnB.  I love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowlege and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region. This keeps life interesting and fulfilling!

With an interest in photography and home styling I get to indulge in this passion with styling the cottage and Retreat and taking photos for our website, social media and other projects.

Peter and Sharyn (original owners) spent two years back in 2001 restoring the 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and creating the beautiful vineyard and gardens you see today. They are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. I love to share their story and the history of the cottage with our guests.

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations! 

My philosophy of "it's the little things that count" will be evident when you stay with us.

name: Peaceful cottage in the 🖤 of Angaston
description:
Plum Cottage is a 1940’s miner’s cottage, renovated to ensure all modern conveniences. Everything you need for a getaway to the Barossa.

The space
Enjoy heritage Barossa with all the comforts.

Bedrooms are carpeted, and each furnished with hanging space, a queen bed and extra large quilt.

New kitchen includes gas cooktop, cooking essentials and saucepans – although you also have breakfast, lunch and dinner options just a five minute walk from the front door.

Brand new bathroom with shower and bathtub.

Multiple living areas for hanging out, eating, curling up with a book, or enjoying the fresh air from the large covered porch.

Sip wine from the Riedel glassware, enjoy sunset views over the garden from the living room sofa, and make yourself at home.
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is on a quiet local street, 5 minutes walk from the main street of Angaston and its shops, supermarket, cafes, bakeries, pubs, restaurants, Casa Carboni cooking school and the Barossa Valley Cheese Company.

Angaston is surrounded by vineyards, fields and gums. Excellent access to Barossa wineries, the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle track, the undulating hills of Barossa’s high country, and the wonderful Vintners Bar & Grill.
